comments.author: u416532@disabled.tld
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:9.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/9.0
Build ID: 20111122192043

Steps to reproduce:

opened the customize windows (not sure if that is what it is called).  Clicked on the menus on that menu bar and dragged to another spot (for example beside the awesome bar).


Actual results:

When I dragged it the animation made it looked like the menus were going to be moved (black line beside awesome bar when dragged to there).  When I let going of the mouse button the menus had not moved.


Expected results:

either it should not have looked like the menus could be move (no black line) or when I was finished the menus should have moved.
comments.creator: u416532@disabled.tld
comments.raw_text:

Steps to reproduce:

opened the customize windows (not sure if that is what it is called).  Clicked on the menus on that menu bar and dragged to another spot (for example beside the awesome bar).


Actual results:

Can you please attach a screenshot showing the issue?
comments.text: Can you please attach a screenshot showing the issue?
comments.author: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: As you can see the animation make it look like the view, history, bookmarks, etc are going to be moved.  After letting go of the mouse button the UI has not changed at all.
comments.creator: u416532@disabled.tld
comments.text:
Created attachment 578798
screen shot

As you can see the animation make it look like the view, history, bookmarks, etc are going to be moved.  After letting go of the mouse button the UI has not changed at all.
comments.author: u416532@disabled.tld
kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 172818 ***
comments.creator: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
u416532@disabled.tld
comments.raw_text:
Actually this is not a duplicate of that bug.  That bug is about moving the whole toolbar. 
This bug is about moving the actual menus, between different toolbar.
